citation.article-title: A new species of thermophilic methane-forming bacterium Methanobacterium thermophilum.

p.s: Description of Methanobacterium thermophilua sp. nov.
Methanobacterium thermophilua (Gr. n. therme heat; Gr. adj. philus loving; M. L. adj. thermophilum heat-loving)
Morphology: rod-shaped, nonmotile cells, occurring singly or in pairs.
Size: 0.36 μm in diameter, 1.4-6.5 μ long.
Colonies on agar grow up to 1 mm in diameter in 14 days.
Nutrition: H2 + CO2 are the source for growth and methanogenesis; requires coenzyme M and nickel ions.
Dependence of temperature: grows at a temperature from 45 to 65°C with an optimum of 57°C.
Dependence of pH: optimum pH about 7.6; grows from 7.0 to 8.5.
Optimal sulfide concentration for growth less than 1 mg/liter.
G + C content in the DNA: 44.7 mole %.
Source: isolated from sludge in a thermophilic methane tank in Lyubertsy (55°C).
The type strain M has been deposited with the Culture Collection of the Laboratory of Anaerobic Processes.
Institute of Microbial Biochemistry and Physiology, Academy of Sciences of the USSR.
